title: Front Wheel - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
It is not necessary to disconnect the brake hoses.
Do not allow the calipers to hang on the brake hoses as this may damage the hoses.
Damaged hoses could cause brake failure leading to loss of control and an accident.
Detach and support the front brake calipers (see
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Loosen both pinch bolts at the lower end of the right hand fork.
Release and remove the wheel spindle.
Remove the wheel and the wheel spacers.
Do not allow the wheel to rest on either brake disc as this may damage the disc and could lead to an accident.
Place the wheel on wooden blocks.
To prevent wheel and bearing damage, observe absolute cleanliness and make sure there is no dirt ingress to the wheel bearings while the wheel is removed.
Thoroughly clean all components and inspect for wear or damage.
